Le descontarán el día a los docentes que adhieran al paro este viernes en San Juan
07 Nov 2019 by Redacción Diario de Cuyo
Este jueves, tras serios incidentes ocurridos en la provincia de Chubut durante una protesta docente, la Confederación de Trabajadores de la Educación (Ctera) convocó a un paro docente nacional de 24 horas para este viernes.
En San Juan, el gremio UDAP ya comunicó que adhiere a la medida bajo la modalidad "sin asistencia a los lugares de trabajo".
Esta tarde, desde el Ministerio de Hacienda de la provincia ratificaron que mantendrán la postura de "día trabajado, día pagado" por lo que maestro que falta al aula lo sentirá en su recibo de sueldo a fin de mes. 
Este el segundo paro que Ctera convoca a raíz del conflicto que se mantiene hace meses en la provincia del sur argentino. Allí están cumpliendo la decimosexta semana consecutiva de paro y, en lugar de morigerarse, el enfrentamiento entre el sindicato y la gobernación se recrudece.

Teachers who join the strike this Friday in San Juan will discount the day
07 Nov 2019 by Cuyo Daily Writing
This Thursday, after serious incidents in the province of Chubut during a teacher protest, the Confederation of Education Workers (Ctera) called for a 24-hour national teaching strike for Friday.
In San Juan, the UDAP union has already announced that it adheres to the measure under the modality "without assistance to workplaces".
This afternoon, from the Ministry of Finance of the province they ratified that they will maintain the position of "day worked, paid day" so that teacher missing from the classroom will feel it on his salary receipt at the end of the month.
This is the second strike that Ctera calls following the conflict that has been going on for months in the province of southern Argentina. There they are serving the sixteenth consecutive week of unemployment and, instead of dying, the confrontation between the union and the government intensifies.
